about_the_game:
I want to tell you a story… story about the Jester. Can you break free from the trap set by the strange Jester, who is always laughing? What encounters await you in the Jester's world? What will you remember, and what adventures will you experience? Piece together the puzzle bit by bit and emerge victorious in the battle.

A mix of dark story and a puzzle, where all the pictures support the atmosphere of the story.

Features:

  • Reveal 6 puzzle chapters including 1 Bonus Chapter, full of atmospheric pictures

  • Incredible different themed pictures – Dark Arts, Fallen Memories, Music of Autumn, Fright Stories, Haunted Phantoms and more.

  • Reveal the dark and heart touching story with thematic 132 puzzle pictures

  • A lot of options to adjust puzzles - rotation, size, cutout shapes etc.

  • Great puzzle sizes - up to 1000 pieces

content_descriptors.notes:
- Depiction of suicide
- Dark oppressive atmosphere

reviews:
“I love Halloween and all the things that Go Bump in the Night I do agree that the backgrounds of these puzzles are a tad bit too dark as far as the color scheme goes, but the images are pretty cool, nonetheless. Graphium Studio knows how to do puzzles right; they always have a bunch of settings and puzzle shapes to make them enjoyable. I love that you can see every picture in the demo and do them in any order. There are six different categories: Dark Arts - Fallen Memories - Fright Stories - Music of Autumn - Haunted Phantoms, and a Bonus Chapter. There are two Puzzle Modes, Mosaic with eight different shapes available, and Classic, which has six different puzzle cutouts. You can also select the number of pieces for each puzzle individually and fine-tune the background color with a full-scale color chart. The icing on the cake...there's a pretty interesting story that progresses as you earn energy by completing the puzzles!”
5\5 – pennmom36

“Another excellent offering in the Jigsaw genre. This one is Halloween oriented and the brilliant colors in the autumn picture set are gorgeous. But be warned: the plot is dark, very dark indeed. Our character is a fellow with an evil alter ego, a Jester, that threatens to destroy him for his past sins. The art picks up the menacing atmosphere, concentrating on a panoply of Halloweeny monsters, (even if the Witch Girl is awfully cute). Music this time is a little over-fond of drum rolls and cymbal splashes that fortunately can be turned down. Overall, a rather intense (and too short) plot covering what we're really here for, some beautiful art. Still, a question for the artist, or rather the editor who chose the pieces. Is there no room for little boys in your fantasy world? It must be a boring place”
5\5 – timothya
